name: Weyland Ice Advanced V1.3
description: Re use of tag ice. Scorched earth is in the house ! Sansan is here too, for more advanced combo. What do you think ?

name: Weyland: Defrosted V1
description:
I wanted to try theory crafting an ICE free deck before looking at other builds. This is what I have come up with to play test.

I chose Weyland for the economy to setup for large Power Grid overload & SEA Source traces if required. As many zero trash traps as influence would allow. Bad Publicity is ok, but having it will not allow other assets to stay for very long. So I still include all the assets as to hopefully waste runs away from Agendas. I could possibly take out Server Diagnostics for E Mills.

Win Plan A: Cerebral Brain Damage + Scorched Earth Win Plan B: Install + 2 x Advance any Agenda, Asset trap, AP win.

name: Exile and cie V3
description: Some changes around ice breakers and more econom.

name: Kit goes where she pleases! v1.0
description:
This is an "hybrid" Rielle deck: it uses her ability to get in in the early game, but then builds a standard shaper full rig for the late game.

Of course there are a few shenanigans, namely Scavenges to "remap" Cyber-Cyphers and Femme Fatales as needed, Escher to reposition the bad ICEs and a Chakana, tutorable with the SMCs and to be used as a temporary patch against Fast Advance decks.

Problems with the deck are the absence of a strong drawing mechanism, and the risky decision of taking out the Carapaces. This second problem can be addressed by playing slowly against T&B decks (i.e. run only when you have money to fight a SEA source): in the end Weyland needs to keep an agenda in a server for and entire turn to score it, so you don't need necessarily an R&D lock as against Fast Advance decks. The lack of a drawing mechanism can't be easily addressed instead so... don't stop drawing EVER!

Finally Spinal Modem+Stimhack. They ARE risky, so use your judgement when to play them: a single Stimhack per match is a non-issue and is the perfect move to get in a server while installing an Icebreaker for free with a SMC; however playing a second one against Weyland is really dangerous, as well as installing the Spinal Modem against an heavy tagging/tracing deck (NBN MN, for instance).

name: World is Tag, Bag'n Adv
description: I really like this deck ! 44 cards, 6 agendas. If you haven't agendas, tag and go scorched earth. If you have one, you can advance it easly. I'll add shipment from sansan when it'll be released in France.

name: Next Gen Fast Advance v1.0
description:
Shipment from SanSan allows for a new breed of Fast advancing, which is not technically Advance, but just token placement. Therefore it's perfect together with Efficiency Committee extra tokens.

Cerebral Imaging cause you will need extra space in your HQ, and to pump up the economy you have plenty of Operations. Howard will help drawing a lot, fast.

Once you get an Efficiency Committee scored (even if you have to "sacrifice" two Biotic Labor to do it, it's worth it), you just need to: install Agenda, advance once, use last Click and an EC counter to gain 2 Clicks, Shipment from SanSan.

That way you can score basically without using remote servers, so the overall number and cost of the ICE is low. To make them a bit more dangerous there's Viktor 2.0, and plenty of Trash Program with Ichi(s) and Rototurret.

name: Weyland off the grid deck
Weylandia - Feedback Welcome
description: This is my current Weyland build - it's not up to much, it just sort of potters around. It needs more of an edge, maybe? Note - I don't have What Lies Ahead, Trace Amount, Future Proof, Humanity's Shadow, or Second Thoughts as of time of writing.

name: Whizzard: Credit Denial v1.1
HB - Guard V2
Weyland - It smells like Meat V2
Cleanin' Em Out (Experiment, looking for help)
description: try to get an early cleaners score and drop dedicated response teams.

name: GroundZero
description: Rebuilding my Rielle deck from the ground up... any comments welcome. Early Gordian Blading is the obvious main tactic. The FTW run can be built by parasite abuse with clone chips and tinkering. ProContacts allows for lucrative mid-game planning, exploring the servers by dealing with first layers using crescentus.

name: Netrunner Worlds Game 3 Gabe Deck
description: Built after the decklist shown during the game. http://youtu.be/J2QWXTL5_DY

name: Kates Contacts
description: My UWC deck updated. 3 hostage for obvious reasons. Plenty of breakers and ways to get them back if necessary. One HQ to threaten even cerebral imaging deck concepts. Now that I got OCTGN to finally work I can see about play testing this.

name: Lightning Fast News
description: get down a lot of passive economy. Get the astroscript or the san san going and start the chain while turtling on RD ad HQ

name: Credit/ICE denial v 2.0
description: Revised from my Whizzard Denial deck to include Chakana to delay agenda advances and Running Interference to basically get a free run.  Mimic is there to fight Swordsman.  This deck is a little more afraid of tags than the Whizzard deck, so a lot of tag-me cards have been taken out with the exception of John Masanori.  Due to the extreme usefulness of each event in the deck I included two copies of Same Old Thing.

name: Professors rig.
description: Lots of redundant breakers so you can discard to FLCC and still get a rig up. Clone chip parasite and important breakers. Test run breakers. Scavenge big breakers and Imps. Pheromone helps with SMC/CC costs as well as breakers. Solid build for professor for the moment IMO. I'm still looking forward to new programs though. :)

name: NBN Slow Advance
description: The idea here is to have a remote server with at least 1 matrix analyzer on it protecting Simone Diego and an unknown Asset/Agenda. Once all 3 pieces are in place you can advance the card twice a turn and dare the runner to run on it and see if its a lethal Junebug, a game winning Beale, or a Ghost Branch that lets you Psychographics out agendas. Zaibatsu prevents exposing the server, and expensive assets give you clickless money. No matter what, always advance the asset they are running on, and get in their head.

name: NBN: TWIY* Super Speed
description: Fast Advance with as much money as possible. Keeps the ice cheap and takes out strategic icebreakers. Rez SanSan at any time you need because you have the money. Recovering from Account Siphon is pretty easy.

name: Chaos Siphon
description: Title says it all. Shaper makes a pretty good Account Siphon candidate as they have resourceless economy with Magnum Opus, good breakers/tutoring, and trash assistance with Paricia or keeping them poor. DLR is there to give them a tough decision when they're really broke (click for credit, click for credit, trash/lose four cards next turn) but could easily be swapped for 3 Femmes if you don't want to count on cloak/dagger for breaking sentries. Same Old Thing can bring back Account Siphons and plascrete prevents the Scorched Earth flatline.

name: Weyland: Defrosted v2
description:
Similar to V1, however this time dropping the Agenda count to the min with deck size at max. Still keeping the 3x Project Atlas for the Tutoring.

Shipment from Kaguya included for installing 2x traps/agendas.

Now with Cleaners & Dedicated response team will leave runner with a few nasty central server runs.

name: Kit aggro
World is Tag, Bag'n Adv V1.2
description: +3 Green Level, + 3 Dedicated Response, +2 Flare, +1 PAD. More Early econom and a big ice to end a run. Dedicated response vs Scorched Earth, i'll figure out the best for this deck.

name: It's expensive to run!
Kate spinal
NbN punisher
description: A typical Tag e punish Nbn

name: Trash ALL the ice! v1.0
description:
Facecheck carefully to get the Corp to rez ice, then trash the ice you can get with recurring Parasites. Use Datasucker and/or Bishop with whatever Anarch breaker you need to tutor up in order to bypass whatever ice remains.

Any agendas you hit with mill are gravy. If R&D is vulnerable, tutor up Medium and go to town.

Very rough around the edges, but iterations of it are 6-2 in tournament play and won me FFG's December monthly (10 players).

name: Iceless Shell Game v1.0
description:
A Corp deck with no ice and no Hedge Fund? What is this madness? :)

Your ideal opening turn is install, install, Shipment from Kaguya. Bonus points if you can shuffle 4 of your cards and then install two of them in remotes.

Whittle away their hand with agenda scores/thefts and Hokusai. Since R&D will be a major target, make sure you put the first Hokusai there. Fetal AI is great everywhere except Archives. When you get your chance, forfeit a False Lead, then deploy EMPs and/or pop a Ronin for the win. You can also win by scoring agendas, but that's less likely.

Work in progress; those last 3 influence may go toward 3x Ice Wall for some taxing and Trick of Light shenanigans, but I want to test iceless for a while longer first.

name: weyland beta
High Risk v3
description: Focused.
